summary: The No Corporate Crooks Act (H.R. 3680) aims to prevent individuals convicted of certain "covered crimes" from holding positions in the executive branch. These covered crimes include bribery, copyright infringement, corruption, cybercrime, embezzlement, fraud, insider trading, wage theft, and tax evasion. The bill mandates removal from service for those found in violation. It is sponsored by Mr. Deluzio and others and was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
